intro: Spermacoce constricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm. The plant features opposite, narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. Spermacoce constricta is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in open woodland areas.
